cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest tonight, cross central-western Cuba on Monday, move into the Florida Straits and eastern Gulf, then track northeastward along/just inland of the U.S. southeast coast and accelerate offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward New England late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-western Cuba (near the provinces of Cienfuegos/Matanzas)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches presently limited to Cayman Brac & Little Cayman, portions of western Cuba and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for southern Haiti, Jamaica, and much of eastern/central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: From Florida Keys northward along the U.S. Atlantic seaboard through the Carolinas to coastal New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (surge estimates <2 ft along Mid-Atlantic/New England)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of tropical-storm-force gusts; most likely scenario is breezy conditions 25–35 mph Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures possible, generally <2 ft, mainly Friday high-tide cycle
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain could total 1–3 in between Thursday night and Friday night, producing localized ponding and reduced visibility
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents on the approaches to New York Harbor and the New Jersey coast beginning late Thursday
